```{r, echo=FALSE}
# Settings

# turn off scientific notation because I hate it
options(scipen=999)

# import csv containing the t-test results for the EEG data
t_test_results <- read.csv("/Users/merle/Desktop/Masterarbeit/Master_Testdaten/t_test_results.csv")

# currently, I only have 1 test dataset, so obvi the p- and T-values are completely messed up

# for plotting, "simulate" some p-values:
# assign random p-vales (> and < than 0.05)
t_test_results$p_feedback[which(t_test_results$p_feedback != 0)] <- 0.04
t_test_results$p_feedback[which(t_test_results$p_feedback == 0)] <- 0.6
t_test_results$p_sfc[which(t_test_results$p_sfc != 0)] <- 0.03
t_test_results$p_sfc[which(t_test_results$p_sfc == 0)] <- 0.2

# Just ignore the weird T-values for now!
```
